title: Pfeffernusse Recipe
description: These nut-sized cookies are spiced with ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, and pepper. They are called Pepperkaker, in Norway.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Pfeffernusse 4.5 (31) 30 Reviews 7 Photos These nut-sized cookies are spiced with ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, and pepper. They are called Pepperkaker, in Norway. Submitted by Kristi Updated on January 6, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Servings: 96 Yield: 16 dozen Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 96 servings 4 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking powder ½ teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon ground white pepper 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon ½ teaspoon ground cardamom ½ teaspoon ground ginger ¾ teaspoon salt ¾ cup butter, softened 1 ¼ cups packed brown sugar 2 eggs ¾ cup finely chopped almonds (Optional) Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine dry ingredients and set aside. In a separate bowl, beat butter and sugar together until light. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in dry ingredients 1/2 cup at a time. Add almonds, if desired. Roll into one inch balls and arrange 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 11 to 14 minutes. Cool and store in airtight containers for 3 days to mellow flavors. I Made It Print 53 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 51 Calories 2g Fat 7g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 96 Calories 51 % Daily Value * Total Fat 2g 3% Saturated Fat 1g 5% Cholesterol 8mg 3% Sodium 42mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 7g 3% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 3g Protein 1g 2% Calcium 10mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 20mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Pfeffernusse 01 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 07 Photo by  Ursula Rudat 12/17/2018 I will make again. I think I put too much butter in as they flattened out a bit and I will double the spices as previous reviews have. 03 of 07 Photo by  SARAKALA 12/22/2017 04 of 07 Photo by  Jess McArthur 12/20/2014 Very good- did not have brown sugar on hand so subbed in white sugar with molasses (about 1.5 tbsp of molasses)- also used freshly cracked black pepper to substitute for white pepper, and upped the ginger/cinnamon as did not have cardamom. Dredged in icing sugar- delicious! Will definitely make again! 05 of 07 Photo by  HBrowning 03/17/2013 06 of 07 Photo by  Polniere 12/08/2012 Great recipe. These are one of my favorite cookies. I added about 2 T of cocoa powder and 2 tsp vanilla extract. Didn't have cardamom so I used nutmeg instead. I also doubled the spices as many people have suggested. Once they cooled, I rolled them in powdered sugar. I also tried rolling out some dough and made gingerbread man cutouts. They turned out great. Much easier to dunk that way. :) 07 of 07 Photo by  scanime 11/17/2010 My favorite of the Pfeffernusse recipes... it tastes like the ones my grandmother makes. I did both a normal batch, and following another reviewer's suggestion, a batch with double the spices (except pepper). I like it better with the stronger spices and flavors. 1 You’ll Also Love Holiday Lebkuchen (German Spice Cookies) 4 Ratings Chocolate Lebkuchen 13 Ratings Crescent Butter Biscuits 4 Ratings Monika's Oma's Lebkuchen Men 1 Rating Vanilla Half-Moons 13 Ratings Drommar 14 Ratings Mandelmakronen (Almond Meringues) 7 Ratings Almond Meringue Cookies 22 Ratings Authentic German Lebkuchen 1 Rating Linzer Torte Cookies 61 Ratings Pfeffernusse III 18 Ratings Strufoli I 1 Rating Cinnamon Stars 53 Ratings German Rocks 14 Ratings Speculaas Cookies or Spicy Sinterklass Cakes 11 Ratings Halloween Shortbread Poppy Seed Cookie Fingers Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kristi
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.;Combine dry ingredients and set aside.;In a separate bowl, beat butter and sugar together until light. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.;Stir in dry ingredients 1/2 cup at a time. Add almonds, if desired.;Roll into one inch balls and arrange 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 11 to 14 minutes.;Cool and store in airtight containers for 3 days to mellow flavors.
